channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jerome Powell will attend Supreme Court hearing on Lisa Cook’s firing
item.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, who has been a target of the Trump administration, is showing a sign of unity with another central-bank member.

item.title: My sister is buying our parents’ $3 million house, but wants to deduct $100K for renovations. Who’s right?
item.description: “If she didn’t want the home, it would have been sold at fair market value.”

item.title: ‘I have an economics degree from a fantastic university’: I’m 71 with $3 million and earn $250K. Is it time to retire?
item.description: “I have a home worth $1.2 million and owe $300,000 at 3% interest.”

item.title: ‘I still have a mortgage’: I’m no longer confident that my costs will actually fall in retirement. What can I do?
item.description: “I think my withdrawals from my 401(k) and IRA may need to be larger than my current take-home pay.”

item.title: ‘I have no mortgage’: Is it reckless to cancel my homeowner’s insurance? I can’t justify $4K a year anymore.
These stocks are leading 'meaningful breakthroughs' in quantum computing, UBS says
item.description: Quantum computing is an industry with "extraordinary potential," according to UBS, which highlighted leading stocks.

item.title: Here's what Trump's push into mortgage bonds could mean for income investors
item.description: The president recently directed Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac purchase $200 billion in agency mortgage-backed securities. Investors bought on the news.

item.title: Chinese EV giant BYD is a buy — and not just for its cars, Bernstein says
item.description: After beating Tesla in the number of electric vehicles sold, BYD has another big business that investors have yet to fully appreciate, according to Be...

item.title: Buffett’s pledge to give away 99% of his wealth could eventually test Berkshire’s shield against activists
item.description: Investors and analysts say the estate plan raises questions about how Berkshire will be governed once Buffett and his heirs' influence is diluted.

item.title: Top Wall Street analysts are confident about these three stocks for the long term
item.description: TipRanks highlights three stocks, including Broadcom and Meta Platforms, favored by Wall Street pros.
